title.narrative: Enhancing the Capacity and Quality of the Humanitarian Shelter and Settlements Response

description.narrative: Under this grant IOM proposes the following activities: Global Focal Points for housing, land and property (HLP), are providing surge and technical capacity in their areas of expertise. Supporting through deployments, developing tools and guidance, and supporting various Global Shelter Cluster (GSC) structures and activities. In line with the GSC’s strategic approach to localising humanitarian response, and responding to multiple requests from the field, IOM is translating the guidelines and online courses developed through the Cluster on “Good Shelter Programming” focusing on distribution, site planning and HLP. Shelter Projects in an initiative that for years has contributed to sharing practice and promoting learning. Shelter Projects aims to improve the capacity of humanitarian actors to meet the sheltering needs of disaster and conflict affected populations, by disseminating shelter responses and learning from the experiences. Additionally, IOM is building on data which shows that diasporas are natural multipliers of information to their countries and communities of origin and is conducting a specific communication campaign addressed to diaspora communities on building safe for Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and then measuring the impact that this communication has on communities’ increased knowledge and use of safe shelter practices in their countries of origin.
